results.title: Helping learners to learn
results.creator_credit: Nestor Lovera, Francis Gysin and National Coal Board
results.brief_description: A modern conception of training as a process of attaining objectives. The use of “feedback” from tests enables instructors to modify their courses and to adapt their methods to reach the objectives set. Training is presented as a precisely designed instrument for attaining precisely defined ends. Intended for instructors in the coal industry.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nestor Lovera, Francis Gysin and National Coal Board

results.title: Health begins at home
results.creator_credit: Ivan Ivanov-Vano, Soluzmultfilm, Moscow and WHO
results.brief_description: Animated film on public health and health education. The spirit of sickness decides to concentrate on a house where a family lives happily and healthily. After much effort the “spirit” manages to install himself but with the help of the medical services the family finally evicts the evil “spirit” and returns to normal life. The spirit seeks other homes where he may inflict disease and misery but the health services are busy protecting the people.

results.title: Health
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Is Britain”.
Cinemagazine newsreel items including: 1. Research on the common cold at Havard Hospital, Salisbury, using human beings for test purposes. 2. The manufacture of hypodermic needles and syringes. 3. Limbless people learning to use aritifical legs and arms at a National Health Service Clinic.

results.title: The Healers of Aro
results.creator_credit: Ronald Fleher, Ben Park and United Nations Films
results.brief_description: Describes an experiment in community mental health in Nigeria. Many people from countries engaged in rapid social changes cannot take the cross-cultural shock of development. For these people treatment combines western psychiatric techniques with ancient rituals, thereby not isolating them from society. Narrated by Ben Park.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ronald Fleher, Ben Park and United Nations Films
results.description: Describes an experiment in community mental health in Nigeria. Many people from countries engaged in rapid social changes cannot take the cross-cultural shock of development. results.title: Have I told you lately that I love you? (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A symbolic record of one day in the life of the members of an upper-middle-class American family, showing their dependence upon machines and the effect of automation on their relationships with one another.

results.title: Harry's half crown
results.creator_credit: Derek Logan, Jim Moody and Ushaw Moor Secondary Modern School
results.brief_description: Filmed during the period, September 1961 to March 1962 over 20 afternoons. This is a film by the students of Form 3A at Ushaw Moor Secondary School, County Durham, whereby the work included film teaching, scripting, location shooting, acting, music teaching, sound recording and film and sound editing. Scripted after their own stories, this amusing film is about a lower middle-class adolescent boy given the chore of buying groceries for his mother but spends the time mucking about with his friends and terrorising the neighbours. During this little outing, he spots a half crown coin lying in the gutter, which he splurges with his friends on sweets - but where has the grocery money gone?

results.title: Harmony in music
results.brief_description: Elementary students in a school ensemble and in a chorus learn how harmony enriches music. The music leader demonstrates the relationship of harmony to chords, explains how chords are built, and how harmony enhances melody and rhythm. The principles of harmony and chords are demonstrated on an actual piano keyboard, with charts, with instruments and with group singing.

results.title: Harmonie
results.creator_credit: Bonnie Sherr Klein, Dorothy Rosenberg and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A gentle blend of music, people and nature; a summer camp where melodies ripple off the waves and rhythms bounce out of the shadows. Every Summer since 1953, CAMMAC (Canadian Amateur Musicians/Musiciens Amateurs du Canada) has held a bilingual Music camp in Quebec’s Laurentian Mountains. Here, people of all ages and levels of Musical ability come together to learn and make music with a professional staff of Canadian and international musicians.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bonnie Sherr Klein, Dorothy Rosenberg and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Harlow New Town
results.brief_description: In a visit to Harlow, one of britain’s new “satellite” towns, Christopher Chataway discusses this modern building experiment with Frederick Gibberd, Harlow’s architect-planner, and interviews a number of people living and working in the town.

results.title: The Hard sell
results.creator_credit: Paul Ellis, Tony Matthews and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Small Business”.
How can the smaller firm make money from better marketing? Interviews with business and marketing experts establish several valuable selling approaches. Stresses the importance of making the right product, and keeping production and sales in step. Includes advice on both home and export sales. NB: Dated and “politically incorrect” in some segments.
